intro: Dicranopygium angustissimum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its small, elongated leaves that are often curved and have a distinct midrib. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure includes a thallus with a distinct central strand, which is a common feature in many mosses and liverworts. Dicranopygium angustissimum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms.
